name: TheAtlantic
text: "Vaccines are not an off switch. It will take several months to vaccinate enough Americans to resume normal life, and this interim could prove long, confusing, and chaotic," writes @sarahzhang: https://t.co/QkgqdA56Ph

name: TheAtlantic
text: “We carry a million stories within us at any given time, and depending what they are, they can help us, lead us astray, or get us through the day.” @tepingchen talks with Oliver Munday about writing characters who are full of longing: https://t.co/Mqe76cotQT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Millions of people have lost friends to COVID-19. For "The Friendship Files," @julieebeck talks with one of them, Mary-Ann, who shares what made her friend Baby so special and reflects on the struggle of mourning a personal loss during a global crisis. https://t.co/SfBCB0uJuV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Voter anxiety about election security is being stoked in states that have behaved responsibly, while states that have been less responsive to expert advice get a free pass," @normative writes: https://t.co/Y6WB12op9c

name: TheAtlantic
text: The historical record tends to overlook the simple moments of pleasure and joy in the lives of African Americans, @reetamac writes. But the artist Terry Adkins brings them to the forefront in these images: https://t.co/VQZk4UwjVV

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: The worst week of the pandemic brought the best news so far: The vaccine is here. All that’s left to do is wait. https://t.co/LCA7bd0eth
